gov.usgs.volcanoes.core.legacy.plot.render

Class AxisRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.volcanoes.core.legacy.plot.render.AxisRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InvertedAxisRenderer

    public class AxisRenderer
extends Object
implements Renderer

    An AxisRenderer is used to render the rectangular axis that surrounds a plot. It includes tick marks, labels, grid lines, and the surrounding box. All AxisRenderers must live inside a FrameRenderer.

    Author:
    Dan Cervelli

      • addRenderer

        public void addRenderer(Renderer r)
        Adds a random renderer. These renderers will be drawn after all of the standard AxisRenderer components are drawn.
        Parameters:
        r - the renderer

      • addPostRenderer

        Parameters:
        r - the renderer

        public void createDefault()
        Create default AxisRenderer. This just sets up the frame to be a rectangle surrounding the space the graph is going to take up.

      • setLeftLabel

        public void setLeftLabel(Renderer r)
        Sets the renderer of the left label of the axis.
        Parameters:
        r - the Renderer for left bottom label

      • setLeftLabelAsText

        public void setLeftLabelAsText(String s)
        Sets the renderer of the left label from a string. This will be displayed vertically (reading up) along the left side of the axis. This uses a default value of -45 for the x offset, and black for the color.
        Parameters:
        s - the left string

      • setLeftLabelAsText

        public void setLeftLabelAsText(String s,
                      float x)
        Sets the renderer of the left label from a string. This will be displayed vertically (reading up) along the left side of the axis. This uses a default value of black for the color.
        Parameters:
        s - the left string
        x - the left offset (negative moves to left)

      • setLeftLabelAsText

        public void setLeftLabelAsText(String s,
                      Color c)
        Sets the renderer of the left label from a string. This will be displayed vertically (reading up) along the left side of the axis. This uses a default value of -45 for the x offset.
        Parameters:
        s - the left string
        c - color

      • render

        public void render(Graphics2D g)
        Renderers this axis. Renderering order:
        1. Fill background
        2. Grid lines
        3. Tickmarks
        4. Frame
        5. Tickmark labels
        6. Axis labels
        7. Miscellaneous Renderers
        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderer
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object upon which to render

      • postRender

        public void postRender(Graphics2D g)
        Final renderers for this axis.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object upon which to render
